sen.j: 信貴山真言宗（しぎさんしんごんしゅう）は毘沙門天（多聞天）を本尊とする真言宗の宗派の一つで、総本山は朝護孫子寺（信貴山寺）である。
sen.e: The Shigisan Shingon sect is a Shingon set that worships Bishamonten (Tamonten) and its Grand Head Temple is Chogosonshi-ji Temple (Shigisan-ji Temple).
The Shigisan Shingon sect is a Shingon set that worships Bishamonten (Vaisravana; also called Tamonten) and its Grand Head Temple is Chogosonshi-ji Temple (Shigisan-ji Temple).
sen.cmt: 毘沙門天の説明を追加しました。
sen.e: The Shigisan Shingon sect is a Shingon set that worships Bishamonten (Vaisravana; also called Tamonten) and its Grand Head Temple is Chogosonshi-ji Temple (Shigisan-ji Temple).

sen.j: 毘沙門天信仰は飛鳥時代にまで遡る。
sen.e: Bishamonten belief dates back to the Asuka period.
Belief in Bishamonten dates back to the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 毘沙門天信仰の訳語を修正しました。
sen.e: Belief in Bishamonten dates back to the Asuka period.

sen.j: 聖徳太子が物部守屋討伐の戦勝祈願をしたことに始まる。
sen.e: It began when Prince Shotoku prayed for winning battles to subjugate MONONOBE no Moriya.
It began when Prince Shotoku prayed for winning battles to subjugate MONONOBE no Moriya.
It began when Prince Shotoku prayed for winning battles to subjugate MONONOBE no Moriya.

sen.j: 宗派として独立したのは戦後であるが教義の変更はなかったので、聖徳太子による信貴山寺創建をもって、教義の始まりと考えられる。
sen.e: The sect became independent after World War II, but its creed remained unchanged, and it is considered that the creed dates back to the foundation of Shigisan-ji Temple by Prince Shotoku.
The sect became independent after World War II, but its creed remained unchanged, and it is considered that the creed dates back to the foundation of Shigisan-ji Temple by Prince Shotoku.
The sect became independent after World War II, but its creed remained unchanged, and it is considered that the creed dates back to the foundation of Shigisan-ji Temple by Prince Shotoku.

sen.j: 1951年(昭和26年)、高野山真言宗から独立し、翌年、信貴山真言宗が認証された。
sen.e: The Shigisan Shingon sect became independent of the Koyasan Shingon Sect in 1951, and was certified the next year.
The Shigisan Shingon sect became independent of the Koyasan Shingon Sect in 1951, and the next year it was certified as a religious corporation.
sen.cmt: 「認証」の説明を追加しました。
sen.e: The Shigisan Shingon sect became independent of the Koyasan Shingon Sect in 1951, and the next year it was certified as a religious corporation.

tit.j: 朝護孫子寺法主・信貴山真言宗管長歴代
tit.e: Successive generations of head priests of Chogosonshi-ji Temple/chief abbots of Shigisan Shingon sect
Successive generations of head priests of Chogosonshi-ji Temple/chief abbots of Shigisan Shingon sect
Successive generations of head priests of Chogosonshi-ji Temple/chief abbots of Shigisan Shingon sect
Jikaku (status of a Buddhist temple) (in random order)
Jikaku (status of a Buddhist temple) (in random order)
Jikaku (status of a Buddhist temple) (in random order)

sen.j: 総本山 朝護孫子寺（奈良県平群町）
sen.e: Grand Head Temple: Chogosonshi-ji Temple (Heguri-cho, Nara Prefecture)
Grand Head Temple: Chogosonshi-ji Temple (Heguri-cho, Nara Prefecture)
Grand Head Temple: Chogosonshi-ji Temple (Heguri-cho, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 別院 円通寺（埼玉県川島町）、遠州信貴山（静岡県浜松市）、千福寺（三重県四日市市）、福信院（三重県飯南町）、大窪寺（大阪府八尾市）、高知別院竜王寺（高知県南国市）
sen.e: Branch temples: Entsu-ji Temple (Kawajima-machi, Saitama Prefecture), Enshu Shingisan (Hamamatsu City, Shizuoka Prefecture), Senfuku-ji Temple (Yokkaichi City, Mie Prefecture), Fukushin-in (Iinancho, Mie Prefecture), Okubo-dera Temple (Yao City, Osaka Prefecture), Kouchi Betsuin Ryuo-ji Temple (Nankoku City, Kochi Prefecture)
sen.cmt: 遠州信貴山はEnshu Shingisan、千福寺はSenfuku-ji Temple、福信院はFukushin-in、高知別院竜王寺はKouchi Betsuin Ryuo-ji Templeとしました。
sen.e: Branch temples: Entsu-ji Temple (Kawajima-machi, Saitama Prefecture), Enshu Shingisan (Hamamatsu City, Shizuoka Prefecture), Senfuku-ji Temple (Yokkaichi City, Mie Prefecture), Fukushin-in (Iinancho, Mie Prefecture), Okubo-dera Temple (Yao City, Osaka Prefecture), Kochi Betsuin Ryuo-ji Temple (Nankoku City, Kochi Prefecture)

Branch temples: Entsu-ji Temple (Kawajima-machi, Saitama Prefecture), Enshu Shingisan (Hamamatsu City, Shizuoka Prefecture), Senfuku-ji Temple (Yokkaichi City, Mie Prefecture), Fukushin-in (Iinancho, Mie Prefecture), Okubo-dera Temple (Yao City, Osaka Prefecture), Kochi Betsuin Ryuo-ji Temple (Nankoku City, Kochi Prefecture)

sen.j: 大本山 千手院（信貴山山内）、成福院（信貴山山内）、玉蔵院（信貴山山内）、
sen.e: Head temples: Senju-in (Shingi Yamauchi), Jofuji-in Temple (Shingi Yamauchi), Gyokuzo-in (Shingi Yamauchi),
sen.cmt: 千手院はSenju-in、信貴山山内はShingi Yamauchi、玉蔵院はGyokuzo-inとしました。
sen.e: Head temples: Senju-in (in Mt. Shigi), Jofuku-in Temple (in Mt. Shigi), Gyokuzo-in (in Mt. Shigi),
sen.cmt: 「信貴山山内」は in Mt. Shigi, 「成福院」はJofuku-in
sen.e: Head temples: Senju-in (in Mt. Shigi), Jofuku-in Temple (in Mt. Shigi), Gyokuzo-in (in Mt. Shigi),

tit.e: Organization of general affairs of a sect
tit.cmt: 用語集にならいました
tit.e: Organization of general affairs of a sect

sen.j: 管長（朝護孫子寺法主が兼ねる。宗派の代表役員。信貴山内大本山の住職が１年交代で就任する。）
sen.e: Chief abbot (Doubled by the head priest of Chogosonshi-ji Temple)

Chief abbot (Doubled by the head priest of Chogosonshi-ji Temple, the chief abbot is a representative staff of the sect and the chief priests of the head temples in Mt. Shigi take turns assuming the post each year.)
sen.cmt: 括弧内に「。」があるため3つの文に分割されていました。訳文は結合処理がされていなかったため修正しました。
sen.e: Chief abbot (Doubled by the head priest of Chogosonshi-ji Temple, the chief abbot is a representative staff of the sect and the chief priests of the head temples in Mt. Shigi take turns assuming the post each year.)

sen.j: 宗務長（朝護孫子寺寺務長が兼ねる。）
sen.e: Chief of religious affairs (Doubled by the chief of affairs of Chogosonshi-ji Temple)
sen.cmt: 寺務長はchief of affairsとしました。
sen.e: Chief of general affairs of the sect (Doubled by the chief of affairs of Chogosonshi-ji Temple)
Chief of general affairs of the sect (Doubled by the chief of affairs of Chogosonshi-ji Temple)
Ranks of priests (a total of 15 ranks)
Ranks of priests (a total of 15 ranks)
Ranks of priests (a total of 15 ranks)
Rank 1 Daisojo (Buddhist priest of the highest order)
sen.cmt: 今回に限り括弧内は不要と思われます。

sen.e: Rank 2 Gon Daisojo (generally in Shingon sect, second-ranking Buddhist priest)
sen.cmt: 今回に限り括弧内は不要と思われます。
上記にならいハイフンを取りました

sen.e: Rank 7 Daisozu (the upper Buddhist priests in the second highest position)
sen.cmt: 括弧内の説明があるとかえって混乱を招くと思います

sen.e: Rank 8 Gon dai sozu (the provisional second highest position, upper grade, of priest)
sen.cmt: 括弧内の説明があるとかえって混乱を招くと思います
今回に限り括弧内は不要と思われます。

sen.e: Rank 14 Risshi (the third rank of priest following Sojo and Sozu)
sen.cmt: 今回に限り括弧内は不要と思われます。

sen.j: 住職資格 （教師資格を有し、得度、度牒後2年、四度加行・受戒・伝法潅頂修了者）
sen.e: Qualification of chief priests (qualification of teacher, 2 years after tokudo (entry into the Buddhist priesthood), official certificate, shidokegyo (four trainings), receiving the religious precept, completion of Denpo Kanjo (ceremony to invest someone with Ajari (rank of master))

Qualification of chief priests (having a qualification of teacher; 2 years after tokudo (entry into the Buddhist priesthood) and acquisition of official certificate; completion of shidokegyo (four trainings), the religious precept, and Denpo Kanjo (ceremony to invest someone with Ajari (rank of master))
sen.cmt: 文の区切りを修正しました
sen.e: Qualification of chief priests (having a qualification of teacher; 2 years after tokudo (entry into the Buddhist priesthood) and acquisition of official certificate; completion of shidokegyo (four trainings), the religious precept, and Denpo Kanjo (ceremony to invest someone with Ajari (rank of master))

sen.j: 住職任命 （管長の申請、特命のいずれか）
sen.e: Appointment of chief priests (application or special order of the chief abbot)
Appointment of chief priests (application or special order of the chief abbot)
Appointment of chief priests (application or special order of the chief abbot)

sen.j: 毎月 ７日 11時 行者堂月例法要
sen.e: Every month 7th day 11 o'clock Monthly Buddhist memorial service in Gyosha-do Temple
Every month 7th day 11 o'clock Monthly Buddhist memorial service at Gyosha-do
sen.cmt: 堂はtempleではないので削除しました。（以下同様）
sen.e: 11 o'clock a.m. on the 7th day of each month: Monthly Buddhist memorial service at Gyosha-do
sen.cmt: 月日および時間を英語の順番に変え、時間の後にコロンを追加してわかりやすくしました。

sen.j: 毎月１３日 11時 虚空蔵堂回向供養

Every month 13th day 11 o'clock Eko Kuyo at Kokuzo-do

sen.j: 毎月２１日 15時 開山堂月例法要
sen.e: Every month 21st day 15 o'clock Monthly Buddhist memorial service in Kaizan-do Hall
Every month 21st day 15 o'clock Monthly Buddhist memorial service at Kaizan-do
sen.cmt: 前置詞修正しました。Hallは削除しました。
sen.e: 3 o'clock p.m. on the 21st day of each month: Monthly Buddhist memorial service at Kaizan-do

Every month, the second day of the Tiger, 11 o'clock Monthly Buddhist memorial service at Kengai-do

sen.e: 11 o'clock a.m. on the second day of the Tiger of each month: Monthly Buddhist memorial service at Kengai-do

sen.j: 毎月初巳 10時 空鉢堂月例法要

sen.cmt: 前置詞修正しました。of the yearではなく月なので省略しました
sen.e: 10 o'clock a.m. on the first day of the Serpent of each month: Monthly Buddhist memorial service at Kuhatsu-do
